property.description: List of fencing methods to use for service fencing. May contain builtin methods (eg shell, sshfence and powershell) or user-defined method.

property.name: dfs.ha.fencing.ssh.connect-timeout
property.description: SSH connection timeout, in milliseconds, to use with the builtin sshfence fencer.

property.name: dfs.ha.fencing.ssh.private-key-files
property.description: The SSH private key files to use with the builtin sshfence fencer.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: A list of ZooKeeper server addresses, separated by commas, that are to be used by the ZKFailoverController in automatic failover.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.session-timeout.ms
property.description: The session timeout to use when the ZKFC connects to ZooKeeper. Setting this value to a lower value implies that server crashes will be detected more quickly, but risks triggering failover too aggressively in the case of a transient error or network blip.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.parent-znode
property.description: The ZooKeeper znode under which the ZK failover controller stores its information. Note that the nameservice ID is automatically appended to this znode, so it is not normally necessary to configure this, even in a federated environment.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.acl
property.description:
A comma-separated list of ZooKeeper ACLs to apply to the znodes used by automatic failover. These ACLs are specified in the same format as used by the ZooKeeper CLI.
If the ACL itself contains secrets, you may instead specify a path to a file, prefixed with the '@' symbol, and the value of this configuration will be loaded from within.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.auth
property.description:
A comma-separated list of ZooKeeper authentications to add when connecting to ZooKeeper. These are specified in the same format as used by the "addauth" command in the ZK CLI. It is important that the authentications specified here are sufficient to access znodes with the ACL specified in ha.zookeeper.acl.
If the auths contain secrets, you may instead specify a path to a file, prefixed with the '@' symbol, and the value of this configuration will be loaded from within.

property.name: hadoop.http.staticuser.user
property.description: The user name to filter as, on static web filters while rendering content. An example use is the HDFS web UI (user to be used for browsing files).

property.name: hadoop.ssl.keystores.factory.class
property.description: The keystores factory to use for retrieving certificates.

property.name: hadoop.ssl.require.client.cert
property.description: Whether client certificates are required

property.name: hadoop.ssl.hostname.verifier
property.description: The hostname verifier to provide for HttpsURLConnections. Valid values are: DEFAULT, STRICT, STRICT_IE6, DEFAULT_AND_LOCALHOST and ALLOW_ALL

property.name: hadoop.ssl.server.conf
property.description: Resource file from which ssl server keystore information will be extracted. This file is looked up in the classpath, typically it should be in Hadoop conf/ directory.

property.name: hadoop.ssl.client.conf
property.description: Resource file from which ssl client keystore information will be extracted This file is looked up in the classpath, typically it should be in Hadoop conf/ directory.

property.name: hadoop.ssl.enabled.protocols
property.description: The supported SSL protocols. The parameter will only be used from DatanodeHttpServer. Starting from Hadoop 3.3.0, TLSv1.3 is supported with Java 11 Runtime.

property.name: hadoop.jetty.logs.serve.aliases
property.description: Enable/Disable aliases serving from jetty

property.name: fs.permissions.umask-mode
property.description: The umask used when creating files and directories. Can be in octal or in symbolic. Examples are: "022" (octal for u=rwx,g=r-x,o=r-x in symbolic), or "u=rwx,g=rwx,o=" (symbolic for 007 in octal).

property.name: ha.health-monitor.connect-retry-interval.ms
property.description: How often to retry connecting to the service.

property.name: ha.health-monitor.check-interval.ms
property.description: How often to check the service.

property.name: ha.health-monitor.sleep-after-disconnect.ms
property.description: How long to sleep after an unexpected RPC error.

property.name: ha.health-monitor.rpc.connect.max.retries
property.description: The number of retries on connect error when establishing RPC proxy connection to NameNode, used for monitorHealth() calls.

property.name: ha.health-monitor.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout for the actual monitorHealth() calls.

property.name: ha.failover-controller.new-active.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout that the FC waits for the new active to become active

property.name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout that the FC waits for the old active to go to standby

property.name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.connection.retries
property.description: FC connection retries for graceful fencing

property.name: ha.failover-controller.active-standby-elector.zk.op.retries
property.description: The number of zookeeper operation retry times in ActiveStandbyElector

property.name: ha.failover-controller.cli-check.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout that the CLI (manual) FC waits for monitorHealth, getServiceState

property.name: ipc.client.fallback-to-simple-auth-allowed
property.description: When a client is configured to attempt a secure connection, but attempts to connect to an insecure server, that server may instruct the client to switch to SASL SIMPLE (unsecure) authentication. This setting controls whether or not the client will accept this instruction from the server. When false (the default), the client will not allow the fallback to SIMPLE authentication, and will abort the connection.

property.name: fs.client.resolve.remote.symlinks
property.description: Whether to resolve symlinks when accessing a remote Hadoop filesystem. Setting this to false causes an exception to be thrown upon encountering a symlink. This setting does not apply to local filesystems, which automatically resolve local symlinks.

property.name: nfs.exports.allowed.hosts
property.description: By default, the export can be mounted by any client. The value string contains machine name and access privilege, separated by whitespace characters. The machine name format can be a single host, a Java regular expression, or an IPv4 address. The access privilege uses rw or ro to specify read/write or read-only access of the machines to exports. If the access privilege is not provided, the default is read-only. Entries are separated by ";". For example: "192.168.0.0/22 rw ; host.*\.example\.com ; host1.test.org ro;". Only the NFS gateway needs to restart after this property is updated.

property.name: hadoop.user.group.static.mapping.overrides
property.description: Static mapping of user to groups. This will override the groups if available in the system for the specified user. In other words, groups look-up will not happen for these users, instead groups mapped in this configuration will be used. Mapping should be in this format. user1=group1,group2;user2=;user3=group2; Default, "dr.who=;" will consider "dr.who" as user without groups.

property.name: rpc.metrics.quantile.enable
property.description: Setting this property to true and rpc.metrics.percentiles.intervals to a comma-separated list of the granularity in seconds, the 50/75/90/95/99th percentile latency for rpc queue/processing time in milliseconds are added to rpc metrics.

property.name: rpc.metrics.timeunit
property.description: This property is used to configure timeunit for various RPC Metrics e.g rpcQueueTime, rpcLockWaitTime, rpcProcessingTime, deferredRpcProcessingTime. In the absence of this property, default timeunit used is milliseconds. The value of this property should match to any one value of enum: java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit. Some of the valid values: NANOSECONDS, MICROSECONDS, MILLISECONDS, SECONDS etc.

property.name: rpc.metrics.percentiles.intervals
property.description: A comma-separated list of the granularity in seconds for the metrics which describe the 50/75/90/95/99th percentile latency for rpc queue/processing time. The metrics are outputted if rpc.metrics.quantile.enable is set to true.

property.name: hadoop.security.crypto.codec.classes.EXAMPLECIPHERSUITE
property.description: The prefix for a given crypto codec, contains a comma-separated list of implementation classes for a given crypto codec (eg EXAMPLECIPHERSUITE). The first implementation will be used if available, others are fallbacks.

property.name: hadoop.security.crypto.codec.classes.aes.ctr.nopadding
property.description: Comma-separated list of crypto codec implementations for AES/CTR/NoPadding. The first implementation will be used if available, others are fallbacks.

property.name: hadoop.security.crypto.codec.classes.sm4.ctr.nopadding
property.description: Comma-separated list of crypto codec implementations for SM4/CTR/NoPadding. The first implementation will be used if available, others are fallbacks.

property.name: hadoop.security.openssl.engine.id
property.description: The Openssl provided an engine mechanism that allow to specify third-party software encryption library or hardware encryption device for encryption. The engine ID could be vendor defined and will be passed to openssl, more info please see: https://github.com/openssl/openssl/blob/master/README.ENGINE

property.name: hadoop.security.crypto.cipher.suite
property.description: Cipher suite for crypto codec.

property.name: hadoop.security.crypto.jce.provider
property.description: The JCE provider name used in CryptoCodec.

property.name: hadoop.security.crypto.jceks.key.serialfilter
property.description:
Enhanced KeyStore Mechanisms in JDK 8u171 introduced jceks.key.serialFilter. If jceks.key.serialFilter is configured, the JCEKS KeyStore uses it during the deserialization of the encrypted Key object stored inside a SecretKeyEntry. If jceks.key.serialFilter is not configured it will cause an error when recovering keystore file in KeyProviderFactory when recovering key from keystore file using JDK 8u171 or newer. The filter pattern uses the same format as jdk.serialFilter.
The value of this property will be used as the following: 1. The value of jceks.key.serialFilter system property takes precedence over the value of this property. 2. In the absence of jceks.key.serialFilter system property the value of this property will be set as the value of jceks.key.serialFilter. 3. If the value of this property and jceks.key.serialFilter system property has not been set, org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.KeyProvider sets a default value for jceks.key.serialFilter.

property.name: hadoop.security.crypto.buffer.size
property.description: The buffer size used by CryptoInputStream and CryptoOutputStream.

property.name: hadoop.security.java.secure.random.algorithm
property.description: The java secure random algorithm.

property.name: hadoop.security.secure.random.impl
property.description: Implementation of secure random.

property.name: hadoop.security.random.device.file.path
property.description: OS security random device file path.

property.name: hadoop.security.key.provider.path
property.description: The KeyProvider to use when managing zone keys, and interacting with encryption keys when reading and writing to an encryption zone. For hdfs clients, the provider path will be same as namenode's provider path.

property.name: hadoop.security.key.default.bitlength
property.description: The length (bits) of keys we want the KeyProvider to produce. Key length defines the upper-bound on an algorithm's security, ideally, it would coincide with the lower-bound on an algorithm's security.

property.name: hadoop.security.key.default.cipher
property.description: This indicates the algorithm that be used by KeyProvider for generating key, and will be converted to CipherSuite when creating encryption zone.

property.name: fs.har.impl.disable.cache
property.description: Don't cache 'har' filesystem instances.

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.authentication.retry-count
property.description: Number of time to retry connecting to KMS on authentication failure

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.encrypted.key.cache.size
property.description: Size of the EncryptedKeyVersion cache Queue for each key

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.encrypted.key.cache.low-watermark
property.description: If size of the EncryptedKeyVersion cache Queue falls below the low watermark, this cache queue will be scheduled for a refill

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.encrypted.key.cache.num.refill.threads
property.description: Number of threads to use for refilling depleted EncryptedKeyVersion cache Queues

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.encrypted.key.cache.expiry
property.description: Cache expiry time for a Key, after which the cache Queue for this key will be dropped. Default = 12hrs

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.timeout
property.description: Sets value for KMS client connection timeout, and the read timeout to KMS servers.

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.failover.sleep.base.millis
property.description: Expert only. The time to wait, in milliseconds, between failover attempts increases exponentially as a function of the number of attempts made so far, with a random factor of +/- 50%. This option specifies the base value used in the failover calculation. The first failover will retry immediately. The 2nd failover attempt will delay at least hadoop.security.client.failover.sleep.base.millis milliseconds. And so on.

property.name: hadoop.security.kms.client.failover.sleep.max.millis
property.description: Expert only. The time to wait, in milliseconds, between failover attempts increases exponentially as a function of the number of attempts made so far, with a random factor of +/- 50%. This option specifies the maximum value to wait between failovers. Specifically, the time between two failover attempts will not exceed +/- 50% of hadoop.security.client.failover.sleep.max.millis milliseconds.

property.name: ipc.server.max.connections
property.description: The maximum number of concurrent connections a server is allowed to accept. If this limit is exceeded, incoming connections will first fill the listen queue and then may go to an OS-specific listen overflow queue. The client may fail or timeout, but the server can avoid running out of file descriptors using this feature. 0 means no limit.

property.name: hadoop.registry.zk.root
property.description: The root zookeeper node for the registry

property.name: hadoop.registry.zk.session.timeout.ms
property.description: Zookeeper session timeout in milliseconds

property.name: hadoop.registry.zk.connection.timeout.ms
property.description: Zookeeper connection timeout in milliseconds

property.name: hadoop.registry.zk.retry.times
property.description: Zookeeper connection retry count before failing

property.name: hadoop.registry.zk.retry.ceiling.ms
property.description:
Zookeeper retry limit in milliseconds, during exponential backoff.
This places a limit even if the retry times and interval limit, combined with the backoff policy, result in a long retry period

property.name: hadoop.registry.zk.quorum
property.description: List of hostname:port pairs defining the zookeeper quorum binding for the registry

property.name: hadoop.registry.secure
property.description: Key to set if the registry is secure. Turning it on changes the permissions policy from "open access" to restrictions on kerberos with the option of a user adding one or more auth key pairs down their own tree.

property.name: hadoop.registry.system.acls
property.description:
A comma separated list of Zookeeper ACL identifiers with system access to the registry in a secure cluster.
These are given full access to all entries.
If there is an "@" at the end of a SASL entry it instructs the registry client to append the default kerberos domain.

property.name: hadoop.registry.kerberos.realm
property.description:
The kerberos realm: used to set the realm of system principals which do not declare their realm, and any other accounts that need the value.
If empty, the default realm of the running process is used.
If neither are known and the realm is needed, then the registry service/client will fail.

property.name: hadoop.registry.jaas.context
property.description: Key to define the JAAS context. Used in secure mode

property.name: hadoop.shell.missing.defaultFs.warning
property.description: Enable hdfs shell commands to display warnings if (fs.defaultFS) property is not set.

property.name: hadoop.shell.safely.delete.limit.num.files
property.description: Used by -safely option of hadoop fs shell -rm command to avoid accidental deletion of large directories. When enabled, the -rm command requires confirmation if the number of files to be deleted is greater than this limit. The default limit is 100 files. The warning is disabled if the limit is 0 or the -safely is not specified in -rm command.

property.name: fs.client.htrace.sampler.classes
property.description: The class names of the HTrace Samplers to use for Hadoop filesystem clients.

property.name: hadoop.htrace.span.receiver.classes
property.description: The class names of the Span Receivers to use for Hadoop.

property.name: hadoop.http.logs.enabled
property.description: Enable the "/logs" endpoint on all Hadoop daemons, which serves local logs, but may be considered a security risk due to it listing the contents of a directory.

property.name: fs.client.resolve.topology.enabled
property.description: Whether the client machine will use the class specified by property net.topology.node.switch.mapping.impl to compute the network distance between itself and remote machines of the FileSystem. Additional properties might need to be configured depending on the class specified in net.topology.node.switch.mapping.impl. For example, if org.apache.hadoop.net.ScriptBasedMapping is used, a valid script file needs to be specified in net.topology.script.file.name.

property.name: adl.feature.ownerandgroup.enableupn
property.description:
When true : User and Group in FileStatus/AclStatus response is represented as user friendly name as per Azure AD profile.
When false (default) : User and Group in FileStatus/AclStatus response is represented by the unique identifier from Azure AD profile (Object ID as GUID).
For optimal performance, false is recommended.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.access.token.provider.type
property.description: Defines Azure Active Directory OAuth2 access token provider type. Supported types are ClientCredential, RefreshToken, MSI, DeviceCode, and Custom. The ClientCredential type requires property fs.adl.oauth2.client.id, fs.adl.oauth2.credential, and fs.adl.oauth2.refresh.url. The RefreshToken type requires property fs.adl.oauth2.client.id and fs.adl.oauth2.refresh.token. The MSI type reads optional property fs.adl.oauth2.msi.port, if specified. The DeviceCode type requires property fs.adl.oauth2.devicecode.clientapp.id. The Custom type requires property fs.adl.oauth2.access.token.provider.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.client.id
property.description: The OAuth2 client id.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.credential
property.description: The OAuth2 access key.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.refresh.url
property.description: The OAuth2 token endpoint.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.refresh.token
property.description: The OAuth2 refresh token.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.access.token.provider
property.description: The class name of the OAuth2 access token provider.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.msi.port
property.description: The localhost port for the MSI token service. This is the port specified when creating the Azure VM. The default, if this setting is not specified, is 50342. Used by MSI token provider.

property.name: fs.adl.oauth2.devicecode.clientapp.id
property.description: The app id of the AAD native app in whose context the auth request should be made. Used by DeviceCode token provider.

property.name: adl.http.timeout
property.description: Base timeout (in milliseconds) for HTTP requests from the ADL SDK. Values of zero or less cause the SDK default to be used instead.

property.name: adl.ssl.channel.mode
property.description:
Valid inputs are OpenSSL, Default_JSE and Default (case insensitive). If config is missing or is invalid, SSL Channel mode will be set to Default.
When OpenSSL, SSL socket connections are created in OpenSSL mode. When Default_JSE, SSL socket connections are created in the default JSE mode. When Default, SSL socket connections are attempted with OpenSSL and will fallback to Default_JSE mode if OpenSSL is not available at runtime.

property.name: hadoop.caller.context.enabled
property.description: When the feature is enabled, additional fields are written into name-node audit log records for auditing coarse granularity operations.

property.name: hadoop.caller.context.max.size
property.description: The maximum bytes a caller context string can have. If the passed caller context is longer than this maximum bytes, client will truncate it before sending to server. Note that the server may have a different maximum size, and will truncate the caller context to the maximum size it allows.

property.name: hadoop.caller.context.signature.max.size
property.description: The caller's signature (optional) is for offline validation. If the signature exceeds the maximum allowed bytes in server, the caller context will be abandoned, in which case the caller context will not be recorded in audit logs.

property.name: hadoop.caller.context.separator
property.description: The separator is for context which maybe contain many fields. For example, if the separator is ',', and there are two key/value fields in context, in which case the context string is "key1:value1,key2:value2". The separator should not contain '\t', '\n', '='.

property.name: seq.io.sort.mb
seq.io.sort.factor
property.description: The number of streams to merge at once while sorting files using SequenceFile.Sorter. This determines the number of open file handles.

property.name: hadoop.zk.address
property.description: Host:Port of the ZooKeeper server to be used.

property.name: hadoop.zk.num-retries
property.description: Number of tries to connect to ZooKeeper.

property.name: hadoop.zk.retry-interval-ms
property.description: Retry interval in milliseconds when connecting to ZooKeeper.

property.name: hadoop.zk.timeout-ms
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout in milliseconds. Session expiration is managed by the ZooKeeper cluster itself, not by the client. This value is used by the cluster to determine when the client's session expires. Expirations happens when the cluster does not hear from the client within the specified session timeout period (i.e. no heartbeat).

property.name: hadoop.zk.acl
property.description: ACL's to be used for ZooKeeper znodes.

property.name: hadoop.zk.auth
property.description: Specify the auths to be used for the ACL's specified in hadoop.zk.acl. This takes a comma-separated list of authentication mechanisms, each of the form 'scheme:auth' (the same syntax used for the 'addAuth' command in the ZK CLI).

property.name: hadoop.zk.ssl.keystore.location
property.description: Keystore location for ZooKeeper client connection over SSL.

property.name: hadoop.zk.ssl.keystore.password
property.description: Keystore password for ZooKeeper client connection over SSL.

property.name: hadoop.zk.ssl.truststore.location
property.decription: Truststore location for ZooKeeper client connection over SSL.

property.name: hadoop.zk.ssl.truststore.password
property.description: Truststore password for ZooKeeper client connection over SSL.

property.name: hadoop.system.tags
property.description: Deprecated. Please use hadoop.tags.system instead.

property.name: hadoop.tags.system
property.description: System tags to group related properties together.

property.name: ipc.client.bind.wildcard.addr
property.description: When set to true Clients will bind socket to wildcard address. (i.e 0.0.0.0)

property.name: hadoop.domainname.resolver.impl
property.description: The implementation of DomainNameResolver used for service (NameNodes, RBF Routers etc) discovery. The default implementation org.apache.hadoop.net.DNSDomainNameResolver returns all IP addresses associated with the input domain name of the services by querying the underlying DNS.

property.name: dfs.client.ignore.namenode.default.kms.uri
property.description: Ignore KMS default URI returned from NameNode. When set to true, kms uri is searched in the following order: 1. If there is a mapping in Credential's secrets map for namenode uri. 2. Fallback to local conf. (i.e hadoop.security.key.provider.path) If client choose to ignore KMS uri provided by NameNode then client should set KMS URI using 'hadoop.security.key.provider.path' to access the right KMS for encrypted files.

property.name: hadoop.prometheus.endpoint.enabled
property.description: If set to true, prometheus compatible metric page on the HTTP servers is enabled via '/prom' endpoint.

property.name: fs.getspaceused.classname
property.description: The class that can tell estimate much space is used in a directory. There are four impl classes that being supported: org.apache.hadoop.fs.DU(default), org.apache.hadoop.fs.WindowsGetSpaceUsed org.apache.hadoop.fs.DFCachingGetSpaceUsed and org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.ReplicaCachingGetSpaceUsed. And the ReplicaCachingGetSpaceUsed impl class only used in HDFS module.

property.name: fs.getspaceused.jitterMillis
property.description: fs space usage statistics refresh jitter in msec.

property.name: hadoop.http.sni.host.check.enabled
property.description: Enable Server Name Indication (SNI) host check for HTTPS enabled server.

property.name: hadoop.metrics.jvm.use-thread-mxbean
property.description: Whether or not ThreadMXBean is used for getting thread info in JvmMetrics, ThreadGroup approach is preferred for better performance.

property.name: fs.AbstractFileSystem.ofs.impl
property.description: The AbstractFileSystem for Rooted Ozone FileSystem ofs uri

property.name: fs.AbstractFileSystem.o3fs.impl
property.description: The AbstractFileSystem for Ozone FileSystem o3fs uri
